results.overview: In 2024, The Academy for Personal Leadership and Excellence opened our brand new elementary school building, located directly across the street from the middle school building, located at 2347 Morris Avenue. As we grow into a full K-8 school by the year 2023, PS/MS 363 is looking forward to serving the community and ensuring our students are supported each day. Starting this past September, PS/MS 363 will enroll new kindergarten students until we have students in all grades, K-8.

results.overview:
Albee Square Montessori Public School, P.S.482 is a new public school opening its doors in September 2024. In our diverse school, each child is seen as an unique individual who will thrive and learn in beautiful Montessori multi-age classrooms rich with materials and experiences designed to support a wide range of learning styles and developmental levels. Through immersion in the natural world around them and bringing awareness of their environmental responsibility to our planet through sustainability efforts, children will explore and learn through guided observation, inquiry driven, hands-on experiences, exploration and discovery..In our diverse school, each child is seen as a culturally rich unique individual who will thrive and learn in beautiful and peaceful Montessori multi-age classrooms rich with materials and experiences designed to support a wide range of learning styles and developmental levels.

Through immersion in the natural world around them and bringing awareness of their environmental responsibility to our planet through sustainability efforts, children will explore and learn through guided observation, inquiry driven, hands-on experiences, exploration and discovery.
 This school building at 424 Albee Square West currently houses Design Works High School (13K963).  For more information about this school, please visit schools.nyc.gov/K

results.overview: At Archer Elementary, we are committed to ensuring your child has a successful, and fun, elementary school experience. We strive to celebrate the unique strengths and skills of each child and use them to make our community stronger! Our goal is for all of our students to become critical thinkers, problem solvers and world changers for our community and beyond. The Autism Horizon Program supports students with autism in a special class with eight students, a special education teacher and paraprofessional with emphasis on building skills and offering opportunities for meaningful inclusion in larger settings. Students in this program may need additional academic support and require speech and language services, including in areas of social or pragmatic communication. For more information, speak with your CSE or IEP team and refer to Specialized Programs for Students with Disabilities (nyc.gov).

results.overview:
At Baychester Academy We Believe:
If high expectations are set, every student can reach the highest levels of academic success.
If all adults are responsible for ensuring that all students excel academically, we will unlock the potential of each and every student.
Great schools are led by great staff members. Every staff member will be an instructional leader who is responsible for coaching and serving every student.
All students will develop the competence, critical thinking, social and civic skills to reach their highest potential in the classroom and in life.

results.overview: Brooklyn Arts and Science Elementary School (PS 705) is an elementary school serving 3K, PreK, and Kindergarten through 5th Grade. Our school provides students with music, art, dance, technology and physical education in addition to the NYC Public Schools core curriculum. Our school has a Dual Language program starting in Pre-Kindergarten and has programming to meet the needs of all learners. Our school day is officially form 8:10 am to 2:20 pm for early childhood grades. We also have before-school and after-school programs to accentuate the learning program of our regular school day and provide parents with a beyond-the-school day option.

results.overview:
Our school vision 
Castle Bridge seeks to challenge the segregation and disparities in the NYC public school system by bringing together and nurturing a diverse community of children, families, and staff.  Castle Bridge develops engaged humans who actively contribute towards social justice, recognize their intrinsic value and agency, and appreciate the role of community in navigating a complex world. We do this by constructing an anti-racist, dual-language, progressive, and inclusive educational program. These four stances meet the diverse needs of our community for a rigorous and equitable educational experience. 

Please visit our website for more information: www.castlebridge.org 

 This school has a Bilingual Special Education (BSE) program: Open to students recommended for Bilingual Special Education (BSE) on their Individualized Education Plan (IEP). If your child is recommended for BSE on their IEP and you have questions, visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms or contact BSEprograms@schools.nyc.gov.

results.overview:
Dos Puentes Elementary is a full Dual Language School that works to support all children developing bilingualism and bilteracy in English and Spanish. Families are our partners supported through monthly Family Fridays, Evening and Weekend school events such as potlucks, fitness night, concerts, fall festival, and talent show and family workshops.  Education is rigorous, inclusive, and supports children's academic and social emotional development. Dos Puentes also promotes the arts through a full music and dance program, and partnership with Studio in a School. Additionally we have a rigorous hands on science and wellness program with PE , Wellness in the School and a school garden. We have a partnership with Teachers College Columbia University and City College of New York to support future teachers, and ongoing research in the field of bilingual education. 
Please join one of our school tours by calling (212) 781-1803. This school has a Bilingual Special Education (BSE) program: Open to students recommended for Bilingual Special Education (BSE) on their Individualized Education Plan (IEP). If your child is recommended for BSE on their IEP and you have questions, visit www.schools.nyc.gov/specializedprograms or contact BSEprograms@schools.nyc.gov.

results.overview:
In 1992, teachers in Manhattanâs East Village founded the Earth School on a dream: to create a peaceful, nurturing place to stimulate learning in all areas of child development-- intellectual, social, emotional, artistic, and physical. Today it is a vibrant community of pre-kindergarten through 5th grade Earthlings, with a teaching staff dedicated to the founding values of hands-on exploration, an arts-rich curriculum, responsible stewardship of the Earthâs resources, harmonious resolution of conflict, and parent-teacher partnership.

Earth School teachers believe in a "child-centered" approach that considers children's individual experiences, identities, and relationships to be essential factors in knowing how best to support their learning and growth. While engaging in rich learning experiences in the academic content areas, our Earthlings are encouraged to explore, experiment, and even sometimes make a mess in the pursuit of learning. From PreK to 5th grade, children engage in countless field trips, ranging from walking trips to visit the many cultural resources in our own neighborhood, to overnight trips in our upper grades to engage in extended learning experiences in outdoor education. 

Earth School families come from diverse cultural, ethnic and economic backgrounds, and our school emphasizes community building and inclusivity--differences are celebrated as key to the richness of our school, city, and world communities.  

Notes: 
We offer an on-site after school option for PreK-5th grade families, and coordinate with neighborhood afterschool providers for a variety of after school programs that serve K-5th grade students. 

Enrollment in a public elementary does not guarantee school bus service. For more information please visit schools.nyc.gov/BusEligibility.

Priority is given to applicants living in temporary housing, who are English Language Learners, and/or eligible for Free and Reduced Lunch (based on family income) for a percentage of seats based on the applicant pool. Students who do not fall into any of these groups will get a priority for the remaining percentage of offers.

results.overview: East Elmhurst Community School is a small, arts infused elementary school proudly located in the heart of East Elmhurst, Queens.  We embed the arts into our classroom instruction through art and music history.  We also have multiple residencies for children each year.  In addition, we offer a Saturday arts program, Saturday soccer league, after school interest based clubs, and an after school program with Smith Academic Enrichment.  Families are always welcome at East Elmhurst Community School through a Parent Leaders volunteer program and regular workshops to connect with school staff and families.  The Lions Den and Peace Gardens are a great source of pride for our community where we have an outdoor classroom, greenhouse, chickens, and a variety of vegetables and herbs we share with our community.  Come by for a tour and get to know our warm and humble community!
